titles: An elegy on the death of William Lord Russel, who was beheaded for high-treason, in Lincoln-Inn-Fields, July the 21st. 1683.
notes: Verse: "To sigh when rebels fall, or shed a tear ..."
Imperfect: stained, affecting imprint; imprint suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Russell, William, --  Lord, 1639-1683 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
